title: Development and validation of in vitro methods for assaying cancer stem cell responses to therapeutic challenge
abstractText: Cancer remains a serious life-threatening problem and the therapies currently available are not always able to prevent its recurrence or spread. Recent work suggests that only a small fraction of the total cancer cells, the cancer stem cells, is responsible for the growth of cancers. We will develop assays that effectively monitor the actions of drugs on cancer stem cells whilst avoiding involvement of animals.
